dc_title_s: Map of Texas from the most recent authorities
dc_description_s: Relief shown by hachures and spot heights.  Shows counties, the Apache and Comanche Indian areas, the Cross Timbers, roads, and land "explored by LeGrand in 1833."  In lower left margin: "Entered according to act of Congress, in the year 1850, by Thomas, Cowperthwait & Co., in the Clerk's office of the District court of the Eastern District of Pennsylvania."  Appears in: A New Universal Atlas.  Prime meridians: Greenwich and Washington.  Inset: Texas North of the Red River.  In lower right margin: "25."|29 x 36 centimeters|Scale approximately 1:3,379,200|General Map Collection
